intro: Dendrobium canaliculatum var. tattonianum, commonly known as the Tatton's Dendrobium, is a rare and exquisite orchid species native to the Philippines. It is an epiphytic plant, typically growing on trees or rocks in humid tropical environments. The plant features slender, cane-like pseudobulbs that bear clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Due to its limited natural habitat and threats from deforestation, it is considered endangered and is highly valued in horticultural circles.
